meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by poor handwriting or spelling.
meanings.sent1: Her cacographical notes were difficult to read.
meanings.sent2: The teacher marked her essay as cacographical due to numerous spelling errors.
meanings.sent3: Despite his cacographical writing, he always managed to get his point across.
meanings.sent4: The cacographical scrawl on the paper resembled a spider's web of ink.
meanings.sent5: The cacographical signature on the document was barely legible.

meanings.definition: A person who has poor handwriting or spelling skills.
meanings.sent1: The student was known as the class cacographical.
meanings.sent2: She asked the cacographical to read the note aloud since she couldn't decipher it.
meanings.sent3: The cacographical's handwriting was so bad, even the teacher struggled to understand it.
meanings.sent4: In a world of typists, he stood out as a cacographical.
meanings.sent5: The cacographical's spelling mistakes were legendary among his friends.
